main.title: Main
main.heroParagraph: DOPOMOGA is an online portal for internally displaced persons (IDPs). On the portal, you can get up-to-date information, answers to the most common questions, as well as free legal assistance.

migrantReference.title: How to get the status (certificate) of an IDP

infoParagraph.infoBlock1: There are now several ways to obtain status and a corresponding certificate of internal movement:
infoParagraph.infoBlock2: In order to obtain the status of an IDP, you must provide your passport and personal identification number. Confirmation of the tax number can also be a corresponding stamp in the passport-book, or the information sewn into the ID-passport (if it is contained in the chip, your tax number will be indicated on the back of the document). If the status is obtained by a child, a birth certificate will be useful.
infoParagraph.infoBlock3: In order to obtain IDP status and the corresponding certificate, it is also necessary to write an application, indicate the last place of residence/registration and the actual place of residence at the time of submitting the application, and indicate the bank account (for social benefits or support) in IBAN format.
infoParagraph.listItem1: personally apply to the nearest administrative service center (TsNAP);
infoParagraph.listItem2: apply to the executive body of the local council. If, for example, we talk about Kyiv, then it is KMDA;
infoParagraph.listItem3: through the department of social protection of the population of the local state administration;
infoParagraph.listItem4: using the Action application. For this, you need to have biometric documents: either an ID card or a foreign passport.

infoParagraph.infoBlock1: On the DOPOMOGA portal, you can find the necessary information about the available support programs from the state of Ukraine as well as from international partners. You can find out about the available financial aid for IDPs at the following links:

hotlines.subtitle1: Hotline for advice on benefits for IDPs and assistance to the unemployed
hotlines.infoBlock1: The hotline is open every day from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.
hotlines.infoBlock2: Calls from the numbers of Ukrainian mobile operators are free.

infoParagraph.subtitle1: Information for those who have moved or been forced to change their place of residence.
infoParagraph.subtitle4: Do I need to have a family doctor in a new place?
infoParagraph.subtitle5: Can you count on free and affordable medicine?
infoParagraph.infoBlock1: The Ministry of Health of Ukraine regulated the provision of primary medical care to internally displaced persons under martial law by a separate order. It applies to those who have moved or been forced to change their place of residence.
infoParagraph.infoBlock2: An internally displaced person may be admitted to any healthcare facility of his or her choice. The main thing is that the institution has the opportunity to provide appropriate treatment. The document clearly states: "All medical service providers are obliged to provide medical services to all persons who contact them at their location."
infoParagraph.infoBlock3: The outpatient clinic or other medical facility to which you have applied must:
infoParagraph.infoBlock4: In the event of an emergency or routine vaccination, the providers of medical services sought by displaced persons do not have the right to insist on the need to submit a declaration of choice of doctor.
infoParagraph.infoBlock5: The program "Affordable Medicines" continues to work for IDPs in pharmacies. All prescription drugs for people who need constant treatment can be obtained at any pharmacy for free. If they exceed the price set by the state - for a small surcharge. Their redistribution by region is regulated by the Ministry of Health.
infoParagraph.listItem1: keep records of displaced persons who apply;
infoParagraph.listItem2: provide primary and medical care to patients in an emergency;
infoParagraph.listItem3: to carry out vaccination according to the calendar of preventive vaccinations.

infoParagraph.infoBlock1: The DOPOMOGA platform will provide an opportunity to receive free initial legal assistance, which can include both providing legal information and providing consultations and clarifications on legal issues of IDPs.
